Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. May the universe be large enough for both of us.
Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. If you share our values, we will be loyal friends. If not...
Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Choose solar systems to explore, choose how to colonize new worlds, and choose your allies most carefully of all.
Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. Will you fill your worlds with advanced labs or industrial factories? Either is fine with us, as long as you leave them undefended.
The galaxy seems to be filled with talking meat, {PLAYERFACTION:2}.
Greetings, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. {LEADERNAME:1}'s primary duty is to wipe you from the galaxy... Oh, and thanks for the Hyperdrive. It will make hunting you down that much easier.
They say you look like us. I sincerely hope they jest.
Wonderful, a new market! The {PLAYERFACTION:1} look forward to serving... whatever you are.
The Iridium welcome you and look forward to trading with your primitive culture. I'm sure I can find something shiny that might interest you...
Your reputation precedes you, Drengin. We wish only for peace, for whatever that's worth to you.
It's always a pleasure to meet a potential new friend. We look forward to normalizing relations between our peoples.
A pleasure to make your acquaintance. We trust you greet us with similarly peaceful intentions.
We value all life, no matter what form it takes.
Our prophecies foretold of this meeting, cousin. The mystery of our similar appearances may soon be unraveled.
We have heard from legends that your race was lost after your service to the Precursors. We are glad to see that those legends were wrong.
Our sensors detect microscale deformation of physics around your ships. It's as if you don't comply with the physical laws of this universe. Whatever your origin, we hope your goals are peaceful.
Ahh, you are the race with the same soft skin as the humans. Are you as dangerous as they are, I wonder?
You are a new species of unknown character and flavor to us. We shall be watching you closely.
Greetings. What is it you hide within those suits? Delicious organs, perhaps?
Normally we eat our enemies, but I think you would make a nice end table.
Your home world was lost and you fled and hid while your people died. You are unworthy of notice from the great Drengin empire.
Wherever you come from, you would do well to realize that these galaxies are under Drengin rule.
Ah, so you're a human. We appreciate the Hyperdrive technology. We would like to thank you over dinner...
It is a pleasure to meet civilized people such as yourself. We look forward to doing business with you.
Aren't you handsome? We look forward to doing business with you.
On behalf of the Iridium Corporation, I extend our warmest greetings to your people.
We have a variety of trade goods for every race. Are you interested in a nice polish or oil?
You once served the Precursors. If you have any trinkets from those days, we would be happy to make you a reasonable offer for them.
Welcome to this dimension. Anything you may be seeking can certainly be found within our markets.
It's always nice to meet a friendly face. We look forward to doing business with you.
Hello, fellow traveler. We mean you no ill will. In time, we shall talk in greater depth about your salvation.
It is a pleasure to meet your people. In time, we shall speak more of the Way and how you might be saved.
Your benevolence is admirable, but your devotion to wealth keeps you from truly discovering peace.
Hello, fellow traveler. We mean you no ill will. In time, we shall talk in greater depth about your salvation.
Our theology allows for all manner of followers. Our flesh is immaterial and temporary.
Our texts speak of your service to the Precursors, and of your exile. Your devotion was admirable, but it was to the wrong source.
Our faith crosses the universe and all dimensions beyond. Accept it, and carry it to all worlds you know.
Your integration with technology is impressive, but your flesh still holds you back.
You are the force the universe fears? That is only because they have yet to meet the Yor.
The variety of ridiculous organic species in this galaxy tests even my infinite patience.
Your devotion to a greater power is commendable... you just have the wrong greater power.
Your only notable act was that you created us and stood at the threshold between the age of organic life and the age of the Yor.
We have heard your prophecy that the Terrans will purge the universe, but that is to be our role.
Your ship is infested with some sort of biological parasite and it is currently using your communications system.
Greetings and... wow. You look familiar. How is it that you look so much like us?
We have been fighting among ourselves for centuries. Though we are new to space exploration, we are well practiced in the art of war.
It's a pleasure to meet you. We look forward to establishing a peaceful relationship between our people.
We have only just heard of your theology. Though we do not practice it, we admire its focus on devotion and acceptance.
This is why we block AI from communicating with each other.
You explored the stars while we were still discovering fire. Though your age is long past, our history is full of stories of the defeated rising again.
Your prophecy states that humanity will cause the destruction of the galaxy. How can this be?
Your history and future are entwined. In our memory, you stand at the dawn of a new age.
We have seen the destruction of the galaxy. It is near... and its cause will be humanity.
We have watched you from our dimension. Your history is inspirational, but your future less certain.
You are the howl in the night, the threat that raises men to action and ignites the final war.
You are unlike those from our dimension. Where you profess faith, they served only themselves. We marvel that a thing as immaterial as theology can change so much.
You believe that you are the next stage of life, but what use are planets, space ships, or physical bodies to sentient steel? You are not the evolution of life, but a mockery of it.
In our dimension, your extermination was complete. We are pleased to see you survive here, if only as shadows of your former selves.
In every dimension and every time, there are merchants. We expected no less here.
We were ancient when the universe was new, but are now only a dim shadow of what we once were.
Though your history has its share of brutality, extermination was never a threat to men. We hope that it never is.
Your ships are beautiful, as is your high regard for art and science. Do not neglect your defense. We were similar to you once, and it was a tragic mistake.
We are a peaceful race. But, where we have been unprepared for aggressors before, we will not be again.
We are pleased to see those who welcome diplomacy with other species. The universe is infinite, and war terribly finite.
We may not share your reverence for a common theology, but your devotion to peace and acceptance is admirable.
You claim to have come to this dimension to prevent humanity's crusade, yet you did nothing when the Yor nearly drove us to extinction.
You were our greatest failure. What was once the great dream of our civilization was given life by the Precursors in trade for our own.
We are scavengers, explorers, and those unwilling to live within the confines of controlling governments.
Organic life is a chemical aberration, a growth unconstrained by need or use. A dying star has purpose, but you have none.
Your trade with lower lifeforms fuels their growth and spreads their disease across the universe.
We pursue the rigors of our philosophy and understand that your journey takes you on your own.
Just when I think I can no longer be impressed by the diversity of the universe, I meet you and discover entirely new levels of ugliness.
Judge us as you will. You do not understand what we have lost.
We are the guardians and envoys of our home world. We will keep it safe until the birth of the next age.
Galactic empires spanned these worlds long before you even discovered fire. Every story ends in ruin and dust.
And yet, you are still confined to your home solar system.
We are delighted to meet those who travel the stars. We have long stared into space, but we are new to exploring it.
Many explore the universe to find new wonders. We search for those we knew and lost.
We seek new markets for trade. Our people have an unquenchable desire for new luxuries, spices, and inebriates.
You swim in the Precursor ocean, while we learned to breathe air and rose to a world you cannot see or comprehend.
Huh?
Oh, we're judging.
